full_summary:
### RFAP for Inspection, Testing and Minor Repair of Fire Systems

#### Brief Overview
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites consulting firms to submit Abbreviated Proposals for the inspection, testing, and minor repair services of fire detection and suppression systems, specific to Department of National Defence (DND) requirements in Comox and Esquimalt.

**RFAP Guidelines and Criteria**

The evaluation of proposals will be based on established criteria in the RFAP document. The selected firm(s) will be chosen to sign two (2) separate Service Contracts with DCC, one for each region.

**Contract Details**

The ITM service contract will have a duration of three (3) years. If mutually agreed upon by the Contractor and DCC, the contract may be extended for up to two (2) additional three (3) year periods beyond the initial period.

**Submission and Evaluation**

Firms interested in providing these services are invited to submit their Abbreviated Proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System by November 22, 2022. The evaluation of proposals will be based on established criteria in the RFAP document.

**Security Requirements**
The Security Requirements for this project are identified in the RFAP Documents.

**Contact Information**

For more information, please contact Craig Patterson at Craig.Patterson@dcc-cdc.gc.ca or visit our website at https://www.dcc-cdc.gc.ca/industry/contract-activity for contract award results.

**Important Dates**
* Publication Date: 2022-09-29
* Tender Closing Date: 2022-11-22T14:00:00

**Key Takeaways**

* The RFAP is open to consulting firms who are interested in providing inspection, testing, and minor repair services for fire detection and suppression systems.
* The evaluation of proposals will be based on established criteria in the RFAP document.
* The selected firm(s) will be chosen to sign two (2) separate Service Contracts with DCC, one for each region.
* The ITM service contract will have a duration of three (3) years with the possibility of extension.
